6.1: Be careful not to do your righteousness before men to be seen by them; if not, you have no reward except to your Father who is in heaven.
6.2: Therefore, when you give alms, do not blow the trumpet before you, as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets, that they may be glorified by men; but I tell you, they will withhold their wages.
6.3: but to thee that doeth alms, let not thy left hand know what thy right hand doeth,
6.4: as your alms in the crypt, and your father who sees in the crypt repay you.
6.5: And when you pray, do not sit like the hypocrites, for they kiss in the synagogues and in the corners of the squares, but pray, as they may be seen of men; but I tell you, they will withhold their wages.
6.6: and you, when you pray, enter into your treasury and shut your door and pray to your father who is in the crypt; and let your father who is in the crypt repay you.
6.7: But when you pray, do not be confused like the heathen, for they think that they are being listened to in their talk.

6.16: But when you fast, do not be like the hypocrites who are sullen, for they destroy their faces so that they appear to men to be fasting; but I tell you, they are deprived of their wages.
6.17: but you who are fasting, anoint your head and wash your face,

6.19: Do not lay up for yourselves treasures on earth, where it destroys you and eats, and where it is stolen, they will set up and steal;
6.20: but store up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither you nor food will perish, and where it is stolen, they will not search nor steal;
6.21: where your treasure is, there is your heart.
6.22: The lamp of the body is the eye.  If your eye is simple, let your whole body be bright;
6.23: But if your eye is evil, your whole body will be dark.  If the light in you is darkness, how much darkness.
6.24: No one can work for two masters, for either he hates the one and loves the other, or he tolerates the one and despises the other.
6.25: Therefore I say to you, do not worry about your soul what you eat [or what you drink,] nor about your body what you wear: is not the soul more than food and the body more than clothing?
6.26: You have seen the roosters of heaven that they neither sow nor reap nor gather into storehouses, and your heavenly father feeds them; are you different from them?
6.27: And what cares can one of you take care of in his old age?
6.28: And what do you care about clothing?  teach the lilies of the field how to grow;
6.29: But I say to you that Solomon in all his glory was not surrounded like one of these.
6.30: But if God thus compares the grass of the field, which is today and tomorrow is thrown into the furnace, is it not much better for you, you of little faith?

6.32: for these nations always seek: for your heavenly father saw that you need these answers.
6.33: But seek first the kingdom [of God] and his righteousness, and all these things will be added to you.

22.45: If then David calls him lord, how is he his son?
22.46: And it was not possible for him to answer a word, nor did he dare to ask him anything from that day.

23.1: Then Jesus spoke to the crowds and his disciples
23.2: saying, On Moses' seat sat the scribes and the Pharisees.
23.3: therefore, whatever they say to you, do and observe, but do not do according to their works, for they say and do not do.
23.4: but they bind heavy [and unsustainable] burdens and attack the shoulders of men, but they will not move them with their finger.
23.5: but all their works they do to be seen by men, for they widen their prisons and enlarge their curbs,
23.6: but they kiss the first class at dinners and the first chairs in the synagogues
23.7: and the aspasmos in the markets and called by the people, Lord.
23.8: but you are not called, O Lord, one man is your teacher, and you are all brothers.
23.9: and do not call your father on earth, for your father is in heaven.
23.10: do not be called teachers, because Christ is your teacher.
23.11: but the elder of you shall be your minister.
23.12: But whoever exalts himself will be humbled, and whoever humbles himself will be exalted.
23.13: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites, because you shut up the kingdom of heaven from men, for you do not enter, neither do you let those who are entering enter.
23.15: Woe to you, hypocrites, scribes and Pharisees, because you roam the sea and the land trying to make a convert, and when he is born, you make him a son of the next generation.
23.16: Woe to you, blind guides, who say, "If he spends in the temple, there is nothing; he who spends in the gold of the temple owes it."
23.17: babies and blind, for which is greater, the gold or the temple that sanctified the gold?
23.18: and if he sacrifices at the altar, it is nothing.
23.19: blind, what is greater, the gift or the sacrificial gift that sanctifies the gift?
23.20: he who worships at the altar praises himself and all those above him;
23.21: And he who shares in the temple praises himself and the one who lives there.
23.22: And the one who is in heaven is talking about the throne of God and about the one sitting on it.
23.23: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites, because you tithe frankincense and dill and cumin, and you have left the weightier things of the law, judgment and mercy and faith; these [does] not show who you are not.
23.24: blind guides, those crushing the cone but swallowing the camel.
23.25: Woe to you, hypocrites, scribes and Pharisees, because you cleanse the outside of the cup and the side of the glass, but the inside is full of rapine and drunkenness.
23.26: Blind Pharisee, first clean the inside of the glass, so that the outside will also be clean.
23.27: Woe to you, hypocrites, scribes and Pharisees, because you compare dusty tombs, which on the outside look beautiful but on the inside are full of dead people's bones and all uncleanness.
23.28: so also you outwardly do not appear righteous to men, but inwardly you are full of hypocrisy and iniquity.
23.29: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites, because you build the tombs of the prophets and decorate the monuments of the righteous,
23.30: and you say, If we were in the days of our fathers, not if we were partakers of them in the blood of the prophets.
23.31: so you testify to yourselves that you are sons of those who killed the prophets.
23.32: and you paid the measure of your fathers.
23.33: you see births of echidnas, how can you escape from the judgment of birth?
23.34: for this, behold, I am sending you prophets and wise men and scribes; of these you strip and crucify, and of them you scourge in your synagogues and drive from city to city;
23.35: as all the righteous blood shed upon the earth shall come to you, from the blood of Abel the righteous to the blood of Zachary son of Barachius, whom you slew between the temple and the altar.
23.36: Let me tell you, all these things have come upon this generation.
23.37: Jerusalem, Jerusalem, the one who destroyed the prophets and stoned those who were sent to her, how much I wanted to bring back your children, as a vulture brings her birds under her wings, and you did not want.
23.38: Behold, your house is left to you desolate.
23.39: for I say unto you, you shall not see me for nothing until you say, Blessed is he that cometh in the name of the Lord.

24.1: And when Jesus came out of the sanctuary, he was walking, and his disciples came and showed him the buildings of the sanctuary.
24.2: And he answered and said unto them, Seest thou not all these things?  But I tell you, there will not be left here one stone upon another that will not be turned.
24.3: And as he sat on the Mount of Olives, the disciples came to him privately, saying, Tell us when these things will be, and what will be the sign of your presence and the end of the age.
24.4: and Jesus answered and said to them, See that you are not deceived;
24.5: for many shall come in my name, saying, I am the Christ, and shall deceive many.
24.6: but when you come, they will hear of wars and you will hear of wars; see, do not be alarmed, for behold, it is happening, but it is the end.
24.7: for nation will rise against nation and kingdom against kingdom, and there will be famines and earthquakes in places;
24.8: but all these are the beginning of pain.
24.9: then they will deliver you to tribulation and strip you, and you will be hated by all nations for my name's sake.
24.10: and then many will be scandalized and will betray each other and hate each other;
24.11: and many false prophets will rise up and mislead many;
24.12: and because iniquity abounds, the love of many grows cold.
24.13: But he who endures to the end will be saved.
24.14: and this gospel of the kingdom will be preached in all the world for a witness to all the nations, and then the end will come.
24.15: When, then, you see the abomination of desolation spoken of by Daniel the prophet in the holy place, let him who preaches understand,
24.16: then those in Judea fled to the mountains,
24.17: He who is on the roof shall not bring down anything from his house,
24.18: And he who is in the field shall not turn back without his garment.
24.19: But you had them in your stomach and you nursed them in those days.
24.20: but pray that your winter flight does not take place on a Sabbath;
24.21: For then there will be great sorrow, such as has not happened since the beginning of the world until now, no, it will not happen.
24.22: And if those days were not cut off, all flesh would not be saved, but for the sake of the elect those days are cut off.
24.23: then if he says to you, Behold, here is Christ, or, no, do not believe;
24.24: for false Christs and false prophets will arise, and they will give great signs and monsters so that, if possible, even the elect will be led astray;
24.26: If then they say to you, Behold, they are in the wilderness, do not come out; Behold, they are in the treasuries, do not believe;
24.27: for as the lightning comes from the east and is visible to the west, so will the presence of the son of man be.
24.28: where the corpse is, there the eagles congregate.
24.29: Immediately after the tribulation of those days, the sun will be darkened, and the moon will not give its light, and the stars will fall from the sky, and the powers of the heavens will be shaken.
24.30: and then the sign of the son of man will appear in heaven, and then all the tribes of the earth will be cut off and they will see the son of man coming on the clouds of heaven with power and much glory;
24.31: and he will send his angels with a great trumpet, and they will gather together his elect from the four winds from the ends of the heavens to their ends.
24.32: But learn the parable from the fig tree: when its branch already becomes soft and the leaves fall off, you know that summer is near;
24.33: so also you, when you see all these things, know that he is near at the doors.
24.34: Let me tell you that this generation will not pass away until all these things take place.
24.35: heaven and earth pass away, but my words will not pass away.
24.36: But about that day and hour no one saw, not the angels of heaven, not the Son, but the Father alone.
24.37: for as the days of Noah, so shall be the presence of the son of man.
24.38: for as they were in the days before the flood, eating and drinking, fornicating and fornicating, until the day Noah entered the ark,
24.39: and they did not know until the flood came and they were everywhere, so is [also] the presence of the son of man.
24.40: then there will be two in the field, one taken and one left;
24.41: there are two truths in the mill, one is received and one is left.
24.42: hurry therefore, for you have not seen on what day your master is coming.
24.43: but you know this, that if the master of the house saw to what prison the thief was coming, he hastened, whether or not he was able to put his house in order.
24.44: therefore you also be ready, because the Son of Man is coming at an hour you do not expect.
24.45: Who then is the faithful and prudent servant, whom the master made upon his harlotry, to give them their food in season?
24.46: blessed is that servant whom his master comes and finds thus doing;
24.47: But I say to you that he will make him above all those who are his.
24.48: But if that evil servant says in his heart, The master is giving me time,
24.49: and he began to afflict his servants, and to eat and drink with drunkards,
24.50: The master of that servant will come on a day he does not expect and at an hour he does not know,
24.51: and he shall cut him in two, and set his part with the hypocrites: there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

25.1: Then the kingdom of heaven will be likened to ten virgins, who took their own lamps and went out to answer the bridegroom.
25.2: and five of them were children and five were wise.
25.3: for the children take their lamps, they took no oil with themselves;
25.4: but the wise received oil in vessels with their lamps.
25.5: but when the bridegroom was married, they all hesitated and worshiped.
25.6: but in the middle of the night there is a cry, Behold the bridegroom, come forth in answer [to him.
25.7: then all those virgins stood up and decorated their lamps.
25.8: But the wise children said, Give us some of your oil, for our lamps are going out.
25.9: But the wise answered, saying, It will not be enough for us and you; rather go to the sellers and buy yourselves.
25.10: And when they had gone out to buy, the bridegroom came, and those who were ready entered with him into the wedding, and the door was closed.
25.11: And afterwards the other virgins also come, saying, Lord, Lord, open to us.
25.12: But he who answered said, Verily I say unto you, I have not seen you.
25.13: Make haste therefore, for you have not seen the day nor the hour.
25.14: For a man of emigrants called his own servants and delivered to them his possessions,
25.15: And to some he gave five talents, to others two, and to others one, to each according to his own power, and gave away.  directly
25.16: Having gone, he received the five talents, worked in them and earned five more;
25.17: likewise the two won two more.
25.18: But the one who took the one went and dug up the ground and hid his master's silver.
25.19: but after a long time the master of those servants comes and talks with them.
25.20: And when he came and received the five talents, he presented another five talents, saying, Lord, you gave me five talents; behold, I have gained five talents more.
25.21: His master said to him, "Therefore, good and faithful servant, you were faithful over a few things, I will make you over many things; enter into the joy of your master."
25.22: He came and the one with the two talents said, Lord, you gave me two talents; behold, I have gained two more talents.
25.23: His master said to him, "Therefore, good and faithful servant, you were faithful over a few things, I will make you over many things; enter into the joy of your master."
25.24: And when he came and received the one talent, he said, Lord, I know that you are a cruel man, reaping where you did not sow and gathering where you did not scatter.
25.25: and when you were afraid, I hid your talent in the earth; behold, you have the dream.
25.26: And his master answered and said unto him, Wicked and wicked servant, seest thou that I reap where I have not sown, and gather where I have not scattered?
25.27: Let them then put my silver on the tables, and when I come I will bring it to you with interest.
25.28: take therefore the talent from him, and give the ten talents to the giver;
25.29: For to him that hath all things shall be given, and shall be abounded: but to him that hath not, even that which he hath shall be taken from him.
25.30: and cast out the unholy servant into the outer darkness: there is weeping and gnashing of teeth.
25.31: But when the Son of Man comes in his glory, and all the angels with him, then he will sit on the throne of his glory.
25.32: and all the nations shall be gathered before him, and he shall separate them from one another, as a shepherd separates his sheep from the flocks,
25.33: and set the sheep on his right hand, and the wise ones on the euonymous side.
25.34: then the king is at his right hand, Behold, you who are blessed by my father, you have inherited the kingdom prepared for you from the foundation of the world;
25.35: for I was hungry and give me food, I was thirsty and you gave me water, I was a stranger and you brought me together,
25.36: naked and surround me, I was sick and you visited me, I was in prison and you came to me.
25.37: then the righteous answer him saying, Lord, when did we see you hungry and feed you, or thirsty and give you water?
25.38: when did we not see you a stranger and preach, or naked and surround you?
25.39: when did we see you sick or in prison and come to you?
25.40: And the king answered and said to them, Verily I say unto you, inasmuch as ye have done unto one of the least of these my brethren, I have done unto you.
25.41: Then he also said to those of euonymous, Depart from me [the] accursed into the eternal fire prepared for the devil and his angels.
25.42: for I was hungry and you did not give me food, I was thirsty and you did not give me water,
25.43: I was a stranger and you did not bring me together, naked and you did not cover me, sick and in prison and you did not visit me.
25.44: then they also answer saying, Lord, when did we see you hungry or thirsty or a stranger or naked or sick or in prison and did not minister to you?
25.45: then he answers them saying, Verily I say unto you, inasmuch as ye have not done one of the least of these, neither have you done me.
25.46: and these are sent to eternal hell, but the righteous to eternal life.

26.1: And it came to pass, when Jesus had fulfilled all these words, he said to his disciples,
26.2: You saw that after two days the Passover takes place, and the Son of Man is handed over to be crucified.
26.3: Then the chief priests and the elders of the people were gathered into the court of the high priest called Caiaphas,
26.4: and they took counsel in order to detain Jesus by deception and take him away;
26.5: And they said, Not in the feast, lest a noise should be made among the people.
26.6: And of Jesus born in Bethany in the house of Simon the leper,
26.7: A woman came to him with an alabaster of heavy myrrh and held it on his head.
26.8: But when the disciples saw it, they were indignant, saying, What is this loss?
26.9: for this was possible, if many were made, and they were given to the poor.
26.10: But Jesus said to them, What labors do you give to the woman?  for a good work has been done in me;
26.11: for you always have the poor with you, but you do not always have me;
26.12: because I was putting this myrrh on my body before I was buried, they worked for me.
26.13: I tell you, wherever this gospel is preached in the whole world, what she did in her memorial will also be heard.
26.14: Then one of the twelve, called Judas Iscariot, went to the chief priests
26.15: He said, What do you want me to give him to you?  And they set him thirty pieces of silver.
26.16: and since then he has been looking for an opportunity to deliver him.
26.17: And at the first of the unleavened bread, the disciples came to Jesus, saying, Where do you want the Passover prepared for you to eat?
26.18: And he said, Go into the city to the priest and say to him, The teacher says, My time is at hand; to whom I will pass the Passover with my disciples.
26.19: And the disciples did as Jesus commanded them, and they prepared the Passover.
26.20: But after the fact, he left after twelve o'clock.
26.21: And when they were there he said, Verily I say unto you that one of you shall betray me.
26.22: and being greatly grieved, they began to say to him one by one, Is it not I, sir?
26.23: And he answered and said, He who dipped his hand with me in the bowl, he will deliver me up.
26.24: the son of man goes astray as it is written about him, but not to that man through whom the son of man is betrayed: it would have been better for him if that man had not been born.
26.25: And Judas, who betrayed him, answered and said, Is it not I, Lord?  He says to him, You say.
26.26: And when they had come, Jesus took bread and blessed it, and said to the disciples, Take, eat, this is my body.
26.27: And he took a cup and gave thanks and gave it to them, saying, Drink from it, everyone.
26.28: for this is my blood of the covenant, which is poured out for many for the forgiveness of sins.
26.29: But I say to you, I will not drink of bread from this generation of the vine until that day when I drink it new with you in the kingdom of my father.
26.30: And having praised, they went out into the land of Olives.
26.31: Then Jesus says to them, All of you will be offended by me in this night, it is written, I will strike the shepherd, and the sheep of the flock will be scattered;
26.32: but after the resurrection I will bring you to Galilee.
26.33: But Peter answered and said to him, If all are offended by you, I am never offended.
26.34: Jesus said to him, Amen I say to you that in this night before the alector you cry out three times, deny me.
26.35: Peter says to him, If you want me to die with you, I will not deny you.  likewise all the students said.
26.36: Then Jesus comes with them to a village called Gethsemane, and says to the disciples, Sit with him until I go there to pray.
26.37: And when he received Peter and the two sons of Zebedee, he began to grieve and beg.
26.38: then he says to them, My soul is troubled even to death; stay here and make haste with me.
26.39: And coming a little, he fell on his face praying and saying, My Father, if it is possible, let this cup pass from me; but not as I will, but as you.
26.40: And he comes to the disciples and finds them sitting down, and he says to Peter, "Have you not been able to hurry with me for one hour?"
26.41: make haste and pray, that you may not enter into temptation: my spirit is willing, but my flesh is sick.
26.42: again from the second he prayed, saying, My Father, if this cannot be done unless I drink this, let your will be done.
26.43: And when they came again they found them sitting down, for their eyes were heavy.
26.44: And when he had left them again, he went and prayed from a third place, saying the same thing again.
26.45: then he comes to the disciples and says to them, Sit down and rest?  Behold, the hour has come, and the Son of Man will be delivered into the hands of sinners.
26.46: Arise, O men: behold, the Lord has come to me.
26.47: And while he was speaking, behold, Judas, one of the twelve, came and with him a great crowd with knives and sticks from the chief priests and elders of the people.
26.48: And when he had delivered him, he gave them a sign, saying, If I kiss him, he is the one; keep him.
26.49: And coming directly to Jesus, he said, Hail, rabbi, and kissed him.
26.50: But Jesus said to him, Do whatever you want.  then they came and laid hands on Jesus and held him.
26.51: And behold, one of those who followed Jesus stretched out his hand, drew his sword, and struck the high priest's servant with pity on his face.
26.52: then Jesus says to him, Turn your knife to its place, for all who take a knife to a knife perish.
26.53: Or do you think that I cannot plead with my father, and let him present me with twelve legions of angels?
26.54: How, then, are the scriptures to be paid because this is how it happens?
26.55: At that time Jesus said to the crowds, Why have you come out to rob me with knives and sticks?  Every day in the sanctuary I was teaching and you did not stop me.
26.56: and all this happened so that the scriptures of the prophets would be fulfilled.  Then the disciples all sent him away.
26.57: But those who arrested Jesus abducted the high priest to Caiaphas, where the scribes and elders were gathered.
26.58: But Peter followed him from afar to the high priest's court, and when he entered he sat with the servants to see the end.
26.59: But the chief priests and the whole assembly seek false testimony against Jesus so that they may put him to death.
26.60: and there were not many false witnesses who came forward.  But later two came
26.61: They said, This man, I am able to destroy the temple of God and build it in three days.
26.62: And the high priest stood up and said to him, Answer nothing?  what are they complaining to you about?
26.63: But Jesus is me.  And the high priest said to him, I adjure you by the living God to tell us if you are the Christ, the son of God.
26.64: Jesus said to him, You said, but I say to you, behold the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of power and coming on the clouds of heaven.
26.65: then the high priest tore his clothes, saying, He has blasphemed; why do we need witnesses?  now you have heard the blasphemy;
26.66: what do you think?  But those who answered said, He is guilty of death.
26.67: Then they flew into his face and licked him, and they healed him
26.68: saying, Prophesy to us, O Christ, what are you playing with?
26.69: But Peter sat outside in the courtyard, and a little girl came up to him saying, And you were with Jesus of Galilee.
26.70: But he denied it in front of everyone saying, I didn't see what you were saying.
26.71: But when she went out to the gate another saw him and said to those there, This was with Jesus of Nazareth.
26.72: And again it was denied with an oath that I did not see the man.
26.73: and after a little while, those who were there came and said to Peter, "Truly you too are one of them, and your speech betrays you."
26.74: then they began to gather and report that I did not see the man.  and directly he spoke.
26.75: And Peter remembered the saying of Jesus in the dead, that before the alector you call three times, deny me, and he went out and wept bitterly.

27.1: And in the morning all the chief priests and the elders of the people took counsel against Jesus, that they should put him to death.
27.2: And having told him, they abducted him and handed him over to Pilate the governor.
27.3: Then Judas, who had betrayed him because he had been criticized, after thinking about it, turned the thirty pieces of silver to the chief priests and elders
27.4: saying, Ἥmarton paradosẽs Ἴἷμα ῷον.  And they said, What about us?  you see
27.5: And having poured the silver into the temple, he departed, and he came and was taken away.
27.6: But the high priests, taking the silver, said, "It is not necessary to put it in the crucifix, for it is the honor of the blood."
27.7: and taking counsel, they bought from them the field of Kerameos for a burial for foreigners.
27.8: through which the wild was called that Wild Blood until today.
27.9: then was fulfilled what was spoken by Jeremiah the prophet saying, And they received the thirty pieces of silver, the price of the one who was honored by the children of Israel,
27.10: and they gave it to the potter's field, as the master had written for me.
27.11: And Jesus stood before the ruler, and the ruler asked him, saying, Art thou the king of the Jews?  But Jesus said, You say.
27.12: And when he was accused by the chief priests and elders, nothing was answered.
27.13: Then Pilate says to him, Do you not hear how many things they accuse you of?
27.14: And not a single word was answered to him, so that they admire the ruler very much.
27.15: But on a holiday, the king would release a captive to the mob whom they wanted.
27.16: But then they had a prisoner named [Jesus] Barabbas.
27.17: When they had gathered together, Pilate said to them, "Which do you want me to release to you, [Jesus] Barabbas or Jesus who is called Christ?"
27.18: He sees that out of envy they handed him over.
27.19: And when he was sitting on the step, his wife sent to him, saying, "Do not harm that righteous man, for he has suffered much today in his name."
27.20: But the high priests and the elders persuaded the crowds to ask for Barabbas and Jesus to be released.
27.21: And the king answered and said to them, Which of the two do you want me to release to you?  And they said, Barabbas.
27.22: Pilate says to them, What then shall I do with Jesus, who is called Christ?  everyone says, Crucify.
27.23: And he said, What evil have they done?  But they cried out more and more, saying, Crucify him.
27.24: But when Pilate saw that it was of no avail, but rather a noise was being made, he took water and washed his hands before the crowd, saying, I am innocent of this blood; you see.
27.25: And all the people answered and said, His blood be on us and on our children.
27.26: then he released Barabbas to them, but handing Jesus over to be crucified.
27.27: Then the soldiers of the ruler, taking Jesus to the praetorium, brought the whole congregation to him.
27.28: and having stripped him of a red chlamys, they visited him,
27.29: and plaiting a crown of thorns, they laid it on his head, and a calamity in his right hand, and kneeling down before him, they played to him, saying, Hail, King of the Jews!
27.30: and leaning into him, they took the reed and pressed it on his head.
27.31: And when they played with him, they stripped him of his clothes and put his clothes on him, and led him away to the cross.
27.32: And when they went out, they saw a man from Cyrene named Simon, whom they ordered to take away his cross.

27.36: and sitting there they observe him.

27.42: He saved others, he cannot save himself; he is the king of Israel, come down now from the cross and let us believe in him.
27.43: I believe in God, I run away now if He wills, for He said that I am God's son.
27.44: the fourth, and the robbers who were crucified with him, mocking him.
27.45: From the sixth hour there was darkness over the whole earth until the morning.
27.46: But about the first hour Jesus lifted up with a loud voice, saying, Eli eli lema sabachthani?  That's it, my God, my God, why have you forsaken me?
27.47: and some of those standing there listening said that this is Helian calling.
27.48: And one of them ran straight ahead and took a sponge that hit the oxen and, surrounded by a reed, watered it.
27.49: But the others said, Let us see if Elijah comes to save him.
27.50: But Jesus cried again with a loud voice and gave up the spirit.

27.52: and the monuments were opened and many bodies of the sleeping saints were raised,
27.53: and coming out of the monuments after his resurrection, they entered the holy city and many appeared.

27.55: But there were many women there who were seen from afar, who had followed Jesus from Galilee, ministering to him;
27.56: in one was Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of James and Joseph and the mother of the sons of Zebedee.

27.58: When he came to Pilate, the body of Jesus was taken.  then Pilate chose to surrender.
27.59: And when Joseph took the body, he wrapped it [in] a clean shroud,
27.60: And he placed it in his new monument which he had cut in the stone, and having prostrated himself with a great stone at the door of the monument, he went.
27.61: And there was Mary Magdalene and the other Mary sitting opposite the tomb.
27.62: And the next day, after the preparation, the chief priests and the Pharisees came to Pilate
27.63: saying, Lord, we remembered that that plan said that he lives, After three days I rise.
27.64: Therefore, let the tomb be secured until the third day, lest his disciples come and steal it and say to the people, He has risen from the dead, and be the last error of the hands of the first.
27.65: Pilate said to them, You have custody; be safe as you have seen.
27.66: those who marched secured the tomb by sealing the stone with the custodian.

28.1: But on the eve of the sabbath, on the epiphoscus on one of the sabbaths, Mary Magdalene and the other Mary came to see the tomb.
28.2: And behold, there was a great earthquake, for an angel of the Lord came down from heaven and came and rolled back the stone and sat on it.
28.3: But his mind was like lightning and his clothing white as snow.
28.4: but from his fear the keepers became conscious and were born as if they were dead.
28.5: And when the angel answered, he said to the women, "Do not be afraid, for I saw that you are looking for Jesus crucified."
28.6: He is not here, for he arose as he said: look, see the place where he was.
28.7: and go quickly and tell his disciples that he has risen from the dead, and behold, he is leading you into Galilee, there you shall see him; behold, I said to you.
28.8: and leaving quickly from the monument with fear and great joy he announced to his disciples.
28.9: And behold, Jesus raised them up, saying, Rejoice.  And those who came near him held his feet and worshiped him.
28.10: Then Jesus said to them, "Do not be afraid. Go tell my brothers to go to Galilee, where they see me."
28.11: As they marched, behold, those of the guard, having come into the city, reported to the high priests all that had happened.
28.12: and having gathered together with the elders of the council, having received silver, they gave enough to the soldiers
28.13: saying, You said that his disciples came by night and stole him while we were asleep.
28.14: And if this is heard about the ruler, we will convince [him] and we will make you ungrateful.
28.15: but those who received the silver did as they were instructed.  And this word was preached among the Jews until this day.
28.16: And the eleven disciples went to Galilee to the mountain where Jesus had appointed them,
28.17: and seeing him they prostrated themselves, but they hesitated.
28.18: And when Jesus came, he spoke to them, saying, All authority in heaven and on earth has been given to me.
28.19: having gone therefore make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit,
28.20: teaching them to observe all that I commanded you; and behold, I am with you always, until the end of the age.
